_**Queen of the South**_ is an American television crime drama-thriller
series. It premiered June 23, 2016, on [USA Network](/wiki/USA_Network "USA
Network")[4] and is an adaptation of the successful
[telenovela](/wiki/Telenovela "Telenovela") _[La Reina del
Sur](/wiki/La_Reina_del_Sur_\(telenovela\) "La Reina del Sur \(telenovela\)")_
, which airs on USA's sister network [Telemundo](/wiki/Telemundo "Telemundo"),
which in turn is an adaptation of the novel of the same name by Spanish author
[Arturo Pérez-Reverte](/wiki/Arturo_P%C3%A9rez-Reverte "Arturo Pérez-
Reverte").[5] On September 6, 2016, USA Network renewed the series for a
second season which premiered June 8, 2017. On August 10, 2017, USA renewed
the series for a third season.[6]

Cast_of_Queen_of_the_South_at_ATX.jpg)](/wiki/File:Cast_of_Queen_of_the_South_at_ATX.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Cast_of_Queen_of_the_South_at_ATX.jpg "Enlarge")

The cast and crew of the TV show _Queen of the South_ at the [ATX Television
Festival](/wiki/ATX_Television_Festival "ATX Television Festival")
presentation of the show. From left: Moderator Jarett Wieselman, David T.
Friendly, Alice Braga, Veronica Falcón, Joaquim De Almeida, Jon-Michael Ecker,
Justina Machado, Peter Gadiot, Gerardo Taracena, Hemky Madera and Gerardo
Taracena

  * [Alice Braga](/wiki/Alice_Braga "Alice Braga") as Teresa Mendoza
  * Veronica Falcon as [Doña](/wiki/Don_\(honorific\) "Don \(honorific\)") Camila Vargas, Don Epifanio's estranged wife and head of the American chapter of the Vargas Cartel in [Dallas](/wiki/Dallas "Dallas"), Texas
  * [Justina Machado](/wiki/Justina_Machado "Justina Machado") as Brenda Parra,[7] Teresa's best friend, Chino's wife, and Tony's mother (Season 1)
  * [Peter Gadiot](/wiki/Peter_Gadiot "Peter Gadiot") as James Valdez,[8] Camila's right-hand man
  * [Hemky Madera](/wiki/Hemky_Madera "Hemky Madera") as Pote Galvez,[9] a lieutenant in the Vargas Cartel
  * [Gerardo Taracena](/wiki/Gerardo_Taracena "Gerardo Taracena") as Cesar "Batman" Guemes, Don Epifanio Vargas' right-hand man (Season 1-2)
  * [Joaquim de Almeida](/wiki/Joaquim_de_Almeida "Joaquim de Almeida") as Don Epifanio Vargas, Camilla Vargas' husband, head of the Vargas Cartel (see: [Sinaloa Cartel](/wiki/Sinaloa_Cartel "Sinaloa Cartel")), and a candidate for the [governor](/wiki/Governor "Governor") of the Mexican state of [Sinaloa](/wiki/Sinaloa "Sinaloa")[10] (Seasons 1-2)
  * [Jon-Michael Ecker](/wiki/Jon-Michael_Ecker "Jon-Michael Ecker") as Raymundo "El Güero" Davila (Season 2, recurring season 1)
  * [Nick Sagar](/w/index.php?title=Nick_Sagar&action=edit&redlink=1 "Nick Sagar \(page does not exist\)") as [DEA](/wiki/DEA "DEA") agent Alonzo Loya

## Critical
reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Queen_of_the_South_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Critical reception")]

_Queen of the South_ 's first season received mixed to positive feedback from
critics. On [Rotten Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes"), it has
a rating of 69%, based on 16 reviews. The site's consensus reads: "_Queen of
the South_ enlivens an overdone premise with action and narrative vigor—and
shows hints of intriguing potential."[15] On [Metacritic](/wiki/Metacritic
"Metacritic"), the first season scored 59 out of 100, based on 15 critics,
indicating "mixed or average reviews".[16]

##
Broadcast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Queen_of_the_South_\(TV_series\)&action=edit&section=8
"Edit section: Broadcast")]

Internationally, the series premiered in Australia on
[Showcase](/wiki/Showcase_\(Australian_TV_channel\) "Showcase \(Australian TV
channel\)") on August 4, 2016.[43]
